abstract: Citigroup’s shareholders voted down an endorsement of the bank’s plan to award its chief executive, Vikram Pandit, $15 million in compensation, in a show of frustration about Wall Street pay.
snippet: Citigroup’s shareholders voted down an endorsement of the bank’s plan to award its chief executive, Vikram Pandit, $15 million in compensation, in a show of frustration about Wall Street pay.
lead_paragraph: In a stinging rebuke, Citigroup shareholders rebuffed on Tuesday the bank’s $15 million pay package for its chief executive, Vikram S. Pandit, marking the first time that stock owners have united in opposition to outsized compensation at a financial giant.

headline.main: Citigroup’s Chief Rebuffed on Pay by Shareholders
headline.print_headline: Citigroup’s Chief Rebuffed On Pay By Shareholders

byline.original: By Jessica Silver-Greenberg and Nelson D. Schwartz
